channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [GROOVY-6806] The type checker should use the transform loader instead of the source unit loader for extension methods
item.description:
The issue is highlighted here: http://groovy.329449.n5.nabble.com/rxjava-with-groovy-type-checking-td5719389.html

If used from Gradle and that the extension module factory is a user defined factory, compilation will fail.
item.summary: The type checker should use the transform loader instead of the source unit loader for extension methods

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

Still seeing this issue when building an artifact with Gradle 7.4.2, which is running Groovy 3.0.9.

However, the compilation classpath for the artifact contains Groovy 2.5.17, not Groovy 3.0.9. (Not sure which of the two is relevant here)
I think the project/target classpath is the proper one to use. If you are concerned about any issues that may arise it is best to use the same groovy major version for compile and runtime.
